a.h1: Central School District #104 Imagine . Inspire . Achieve

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.h3: We Miss You. We Love You. Stay Safe and Well!

div.p: Resources are available on the school website at central104.org. This includes mental health support, nutritional support, remote learning plan, staff contact, district updates and more!Please reach out to your students teacher for additional resources. Stay safe! We miss you!

These ladies are the real MVPs! They came to us without hesitation to help provide lunches for our studies during this time of need. We couldn’t ensure the health of our students without them! So we say THANK YOU to our wonderful cafeteria ladies for preparing meals with love and care! We are blessed with the best! 💙💛

“Went for a walk at the coal mine park today.
Took this picture of JAMS. It’s a Monday, what’s missing ? Cars in the parking lot, parents dropping off students, students riding bikes, walking or getting off the bus, and of course, staff greeting students as they prepare for a new week of becoming better versions of themselves.”
-Mr.John, Central 104 Custodian and Difference Maker

It's Central 104 Family Day! We weren't able to have a neighborhood parade, but that didn't stop us! Check out our version of a virtual parade! Hope it brings a smile to your face :) We love & miss you all so very much! Stay safe!
https://animoto.com/play/KX5VeCLHbkhocEZDBVJDUw

We are FAMILY and we are in this TOGETHER!
Share daily 📸 pictures with your teacher, post them in the comments👇🏾or email to banderson@central104.org.

p.a: Event: Last Day of School-Early Dismissal

div.p: School’s Out… Lunch is coming! Tuesday, March 17 and Wednesday, March 18 A group of local churches and the YMCA are partnering with local businesses and Illinois Central Bus Company to...
Dear Central 104 Families, As you are aware, there are two confirmed cases of COVID-19 in St. Clair County. The media reports that they are both under quarantine after returning from travel...
Each year the 3rd grade classes join together to put on a "Wax Museum" for family and friends. Each student conducts their own research on the person of their choice. They work in the classroom...
